intro: Asperula graveolens var. majoriflora, commonly known as the sweet woodruff, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and emit a mild, pleasant aroma when crushed. It is often used in herbal medicine and as a ground cover in gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
